intro: Pouzolzia propinqua, commonly known as the common pouzolzia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wet or marshy environments, often found along the edges of ponds and streams. The plant has slender, erect stems that are often reddish in color and bear small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a distinctive, rough texture. Pouzolzia propinqua plays a role in stabilizing wetland soils and provides habitat for various small invertebrates.
